reviews.text: We stayed at the Amelindo Residence hotel the first and last night of our trip to Europe. Having missed our connection to Rome, I emailed the hotel and their free shuttle was at the airport right on time to pick us up from another flight. Maria and Gustavo the two front desk personnel we encountered were great. They assisted us with all of our requests and questions and couldn't have been nicer. The room we stayed in was a one bedroom apartment and was more space than we needed, but it was great. The rooms were clean and nicely appointed and even had wonderful bathroom amenities including toothbrushes, shampoo, shower cap and more. Breakfast was unexpected and apparently a new addition to the hotel since we had booked the room. The cappuccino was the best I had in Italy and I loved the pan du chocolate pastries which were served warm and fresh. We left after a one night stay to go on a cruise and looked forward to spending our last night in Italy at the Amelindo Residence. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone who needs to overnight close to the Rome airport. I only wish that all of our Italian accommodations could have been this nice.
reviews.title: Best hotel stay of our trip

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here one night before leaving Rome. The staff was incredibly flexible given the various issues we had nailing down our time of arrival. The free van was an incredible help. The site was clean, had a kitchenette and very modern layout. It was like a little apartment. Everyone was incredibly helpful and nice. This is definitely where I'll stay again if I ever have a need for a place to hang my hat before an very early flight out of FCO.
reviews.title: Cute, clean and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The noise of the planes was really slight, I thought. I had no trouble getting to sleep at all.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for one night to visit Rome before we returned home to the UK.
reviews.title: Great place to stay near Rome airport

reviews.text: We were so surprised by the room quality and the value for money and would highly recommend this as a base for visiting Rome. Its a free 10 min shuttle bus to the aiport then a 45 min bus journey into the centre of Rome. While this may seem like a long way from the centre of Rome, the hotel makes up for it with the quality of the rooms. The breakfast is also very good.
reviews.title: Best place to stay near FMO

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner & I stayed here for 1 night after our 6 week European holiday before our flight back to Australia and we couldn't have chosen a better place to stay. We chose the 1 Bedroom Apartment which was large and spacious enough for us to re-pack and organise our luggage prior to coming home. The rates were very reasonable and the service was exceptional with a complimentary shuttle pick up from to Fiumicino Airport. There was also a pizzeria located right next door where we grabbed takeaway for dinner.
reviews.title: Modern & Spacious

reviews.text: I won't hesitate to stay here again when next I visit Rome.
reviews.title: New, clean and comfortable

reviews.text: Stayed one night on arrival at Fiumicino. We were driving and it was a little bit hard to find late at night, but once we found it we were very happy with the quality of the accommodation and the price we paid. Very efficient and helpful staff - run by a lady who lived in Australia for 25 years so speaking English is no problem. The rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was more than adequate with helpful staff again. We didn't use the kitchen facilities, but there were there if you had a longer stay. We had 2 rooms and both were excellent.
reviews.title: Awesome place.

reviews.text: After just spending time in Rome, Florence, Venice, Munich, Milan and Nice at a variety of different places we needed a place close to FCO airport. The Amelindo residences turned out to be an awesome place. It was extremely clean, comfortable, well kept and tastefully decorated. Parking is free and breakfast is free. There is also a free shuttle to the airport. It is very apparent that the owner cares about this place. There is attention to every detail. The gal at the front desk was friendly and helpful and speaks several different languages. The rooms are safe and reasonably priced. There is an elevator. Across the street from the Amelindo is a pizza restaurant that is reasonably priced and delicious. I am so glad we stayed here.
reviews.title: New, clean, but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 1 night with my hubby and 3 year old and 1 year old.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient, excellent service

reviews.text: We liked everything about the stay except for ONE thing. (I'll get to that later)
reviews.title: Perfect place to fly out

reviews.text: Free wi-fi, clean and spacious rooms (OH MY!! they are like apartments - even has a kitchenette), complimentary breakfast with variety of choices.. all were impressive BUT!!
reviews.title: Amazing value near the Airport

reviews.text: The shuttle service had not clearly informed me of the meeting point and left us stranded. I told the lady that I will be taking the 8:30pm bus to arrive at the airport from Rome. Logically, it would make sense to give 45min+ for the bus ride. Well, she sent the shuttle for our pickup at 9pm, the driver left since we weren't there at 9. We arrived at the pickup point at 9:20pm and after several phone calls, we got picked up at 10:30pm. And when I expressed my discomfort of this situation, all the lady at the front said was that I should understand because this is "free" and "complimentary" shuttle service.
reviews.title: Perfect place to situate yourself prior to an early morning flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My advice to you is - make sure you know where the meeting point at the airport is, and be ready to wait if the shuttle doesn't show.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We had chosen this hotel for a one night stay before our morning flight back home based on TA reviews and we were pleased to be greeted early afternoon by curteous and helpful staff. This "hotel" airport has everything you may be looking for: free airport shuttle, complimentary breakfast, free wi-fi, clean rooms and common areas, comfortable beds, large TV screen, free parking. This hotel is brand new and it shows. Very reasonable rates to top it off makes it a sure bet.
reviews.title: Could not find the free hotel shuttle....I wished I had chosen a brand named hotel

reviews.text: Lovely residence hotel. Rooms are very large and exceptionally clean. Nice (free) shuttle service. Lovely staff. We stayed for one night on our way back from a road trip in Italy, instead of going into Rome. Smartest move we made. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Perfect spot near airport
Very nice room. Good basic services.no frills.
reviews.text: The location is nice, In a pleasant neighborhood, but far from airport. Luckily shuttle is free if you can find it. I had to use my cell phone at a $ a minute to call hotel 2x to find it. The girl was snippy , the second time I called, and told me they sent info in email about shuttle location, but that email came after I had left for Europe 18 days previously- so I never received it. The Rooms are very nice, I had asked for 2 beds and got one. Very large, modern rooms, ours had a huge terrace, sitting area, But probably the smallest opening to the corner Shower I have ever seen! It was laughable. Breakfast was basically continental.heres the problem, I had flight problems and needed to contact Delta and Amex Travel, they have no phone service in the room, there's phones but they do not work. So when Amex travel called me back I had to go to the lobby to get the call. Then they were not happy with me, because they have one line and this was their only phone, so they asked me to hang up. I had to ave them. Call me back on my cell at $1.00 a minute. So a good hotel if you do not need any extra services or have an emergency. There is a nice restaurant down the street, RestOrigano, very good food and service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved our stay here. It was handy to the airport in Roma, saved us travelling into the city before our cruise.
reviews.title: Thoroughly recommend staying here.

reviews.text: The accommodation is like an apartment, with excellent kitchen facilities, cook top, full size fridge etc. Great air con, nice balcony.
reviews.title: A wonderful respite after the rigours of a train journey from Florence
Excellent location
reviews.text: Friendly helpful staff.
